intro: Soroseris gillii subsp. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy soroseris, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinguishing feature from other members of the species. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
